title: Iran’s Captive Minds
description: A blockbuster story about Tehran’s influence peddling shows the peril of seeking access with despots.

title: Americans Deserve Better From the House of Representatives
description: A tiny faction of Republican extremists are again putting their interests over the business of running the government.

title: How Four Leaders Are Turning the World Upside Down
description: That was not the plan.

title: Kevin McCarthy Was Ousted as House Speaker
description: Also, Sam Bankman-Fried’s trial begins. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Drug Makers Agree to Negotiate With Medicare on Prices of 10 Medications
description: The pharmaceutical companies said they would begin talks even as several of them were suing the Biden administration over a new law authorizing the negotiations.

title: How Newsom’s Choice for Feinstein’s Successor Was Complicated By Two TV Interviews
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California’s choice of a successor to Dianne Feinstein was complicated by two television interviews that attracted political pressure from many sides.

title: Venice Bus Plunge Kills at Least 21
description: Italian officials said that the bus had been full of tourists, and that two minors were among the dead.

title: Trump Ordered Not to Comment on Judge or Staff in Fraud Case
description: The former president attacked the judge’s clerk in a social media post that quickly disappeared.

title: ‘Elemental’ Morphs From Flop to Hit, Raising Questions Along the Way
description: The Pixar film struggled at the box office initially. It has now made $500 million, but not before prompting the studio to re-examine its release strategy.

title: Here’s How Many Votes Kevin McCarthy Needs to Survive
description: The number will depend on how many House members show up to vote.

title: Miles de migrantes son encarcelados en la frontera como testigos
description: El Departamento de Justicia ha invocado una ley de 200 años de antigüedad para detener a miles de migrantes indocumentados a fin de que declaren en casos contra traficantes de personas. Algunos han estado privados de la libertad seis meses o más.

title: How Chelsea Became the Unlikely Center of the Art World
description: The art business took over a neighborhood on the Far West Side of Manhattan previously known as Gasoline Alley. Then the city turned the area into a ‘monument to real estate developers.’

title: There Is No Clear Replacement Candidate for McCarthy
description: Republicans focused on ousting Speaker Kevin McCarthy aren’t in agreement about who they want to replace him.

title: Gaetz’s Challenge to McCarthy Draws Attention to His Ethics Issues
description: Representative Matt Gaetz is facing a House Committee inquiry into allegations of sexual misconduct and misuse of funds. Speaker Kevin McCarthy has argued Mr. Gaetz’s attempt to oust him is payback.

title: Supreme Court Skeptical in That Could Hobble Consumer Watchdog
description: The justices heard a challenge to the way Congress funded the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau but seemed persuaded that it was constitutional.

title: Justice Department Detains Thousands of Immigrants as Witnesses
description: The Justice Department has invoked a 200-year-old law to detain thousands of undocumented immigrants as witnesses in smuggling cases. Judges have locked up some for six months or more.

title: As Trump’s Legal Woes Have Escalated, So Have His Violent Remarks
description: Recent incendiary statements by the former president, including that shoplifters should be shot, come at a time when his supporters are already angry over his indictments.

title: McCarthy’s journey to the speakership foreshadowed a fractious House.
Where Was Mayor Eric Adams During New York City Flooding?
description: With residents unprepared for New York City’s recent flooding, it was a day of unnecessary chaos and frustration.

title: How to Start Reversing Insulin Resistance
description: Insulin resistance can lead to a host of health problems — but it’s also reversible if you act. Here’s how.

title: What Is Insulin Resistance and How Do You Know if You Have it?
description: We asked experts to explain the condition, its early signs and when to take them seriously.

title: Same-Sex Behavior Evolved in Many Mammals to Reduce Conflict, Study Suggests
description: But the researchers cautioned that the work could not shed much light on sexual orientation in humans.

title: How Barstool’s Dave Portnoy Built a Pizza Empire
description: The controversial sports media figure is now almost certainly the most influential person in pizza.

title: A tactic known as ‘elastic defense’ is one of several factors aiding Russia.
McCarthy Says He Won’t Seek a Deal With Democrats to Keep His Post
description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s slender majority and the number of right-wing rebels in favor of ousting him mean that he has little chance of survival without at least some support from Democrats.

title: What to Know About Sam Bankman-Fried’s Fraud Trial
description: Mr. Bankman-Fried is accused of orchestrating a vast scheme to siphon billions of dollars of FTX customer money.

title: Biden Has to Look Beyond Trump and His MAGA Millions
description: Americans should start to think — out loud — about the kinds of structural reforms we might pursue to make our democracy more resilient.

title: 14-Year-Old Fatally Shoots 3 at Mall in Bangkok, Officials Say
description: Another four people were injured. The teenage suspect was quickly arrested. It was unclear how he would have obtained a gun.

title: A Plot to Oust the House Speaker Hits Weary Investors
description: Matt Gaetz’s move to unseat Kevin McCarthy is adding volatility to equity and bond markets.

title: The Justices Return
description: Business regulation is the big story of the new Supreme Court term.

title: Nobel Prize in Physics Awarded to 3 Scientists for Work on Electrons
description: The work by this year’s prize recipients concerns electrons in flashes of light.

title: Here’s What Happens Now That Gaetz Has Moved to Oust McCarthy
description: The “motion to vacate” that Representative Matt Gaetz put forward on Monday sets up a two-day showdown between the speaker and hard-right Republicans in the House.

title: Telling the Truth About Mexico, and Dying for It
description: Drug violence and government corruption have put the country’s journalists in peril. In one town, reporters tried to fight back.

title: Hunter Biden Set to Be Arraigned Over Federal Gun Charges
description: Mr. Biden intends to plead not guilty, but if convicted, he could face up to 25 years in prison and $750,000 in fines.

title: Biden Has to Look Beyond Trump and His MAGA Millions
description: Americans should start to think — out loud — about the kinds of structural reforms we might pursue to make our democracy more resilient.

title: Americans Are Losing Trust in Science After Covid
description: We may be entering a new political order polarized around institutional trust.

title: The Best Parts of Being a Football Fan Are Off the Field
description: The N.F.L. season began with dramatic injuries. Luckily, for the league, we fans focus our energy on so many things besides the actual gameplay.

title: How Trump’s Idea to Use Military Force in Mexico Became Embraced by GOP
description: The Republican push to use military force in Mexico against drug cartels started in the Trump White House. He has plans to make the idea a reality in 2025.

title: In Shipping, a Push to Slash Emissions by Harnessing the Wind
description: More ships are running on wind power, as the global industry tries to fight climate change. One concept has backing from Abba, the Swedish pop stars.

title: In America, Not Having a College Degree Can Take Years Off Your Life
description: There are two Americas, and they are divided by a college degree.

title: Best San Francisco Restaurants
description: From world-class Korean barbecue to Mission-style burritos to quintessential California cuisine, here are our current favorites.

title: Young People Left in Limbo as Battle Over Transgender Care Shifts to Court
description: After losing in statehouses, supporters of transgender rights filed lawsuits in at least 14 states to convince judges that transition care for minors was safe.

title: An Ice Cream Tour of Mexico City
description: A guide to five of the capital’s best ice cream parlors, from artisanal storefronts with flavors like prickly pear and blue maize to classic shops where generations have gone for treats.

title: In the Big City, Wildlife Researchers Are On the Prowl
description: Scientists are studying urban animals and the diseases they carry, to understand the potential risks to people, pets and the animals themselves.

title: Haters, Waiters, Fools and Buffoons: Eric Adams Rates His Critics
description: The mayor has lashed out at the many critiques of his administration, sometimes questioning whether they may be racially biased.

title: Parents of Baby Found Dead in Brooklyn Had History of Abuse
description: A Brooklyn judge ordered Ella Vitalis, 1, who died of blunt force trauma, to stay with her parents, after the child welfare agency argued she should be removed.

title: China Is Suffering a Brain Drain. The U.S. Isn’t Exploiting It.
description: China’s brightest minds, including tech professionals, are emigrating, but many are not heading to America. We spoke to them to ask why.

title: Takeaways From a New Book on Sam Bankman-Fried
description: “Going Infinite,” by Michael Lewis, offers a behind-the-scenes account of Mr. Bankman-Fried’s rise and fall.
